conbody.p: A vaned rotor and two vaned stators are the basic components of the retarder. Application of the retarder control valve fills the cavity around the rotor with oil when the vehicle must be slowed on steep downgrades. When the cavity is emptied, the rotor is free of drag.

Maximum retarder effect occurs in the lowest gear range with foot off of the accelerator pedal. Long continuous use of the retarder will raise transmission oil temperature. Short periods of full release, to interrupt continuous application, will help prevent overheating.

During normal operation the dash mounted transmission oil temperature gauge should read in the green zone. However, during transmission retarder operation oil temperature can enter the yellow 'Retarder On' zone but should not enter the red zone.
